text: Hi, I'm Emily Graslie, chief curiosity correspondent for the Field Museum here in Chicago and host of The Brain Scoop!
What's The Brain Scoop? Well...
[ELECTRONIC BUZZING]
EMILY: I don't even think about the fact that I'm practically kissing this thing.
ADAM FERGUSON: It is like we said. We don't – we don't cut the anal glands, right?

If we do that we're in serious trouble.
– In the splash zone.
– Yeah.
[BOTH LAUGH]
BOTH: Glow rocks!
Dimetrodon wasn't a dinosaur.
How do you get his Dino-Strike jaw?
Just think about it this way: you just completed your first period on an expedition
and there is virtually nothing that can stop you now.

EMILY: Is this how you typically catch venomous snakes in the wild? You put them in a tube?
PABLO VENEGAS: Mhm.
PEGGY MACNAMARA: I don't want any color to feel left out.

– Like they talk to one another?
PEGGY: Yeah, like, "oh she likes you better than me."

CRYSTAL MAIER: Do you want to see some cockroaches?
EMILY: Yes.

Wow! Those are huge!
CRYSTAL: These are giant cave roaches.
EMILY: What is this? Oh my goodness!
It's a little pupper!
EMILY: You want my arm? Can I give you my arms?
JOHN BATES: It takes upwards of 40% of the female's body cavity by the time they're ready to lay.
PAULA CUSHING: and he sticks his jaws Into her genital opening and he starts to chew. I know!

EMILY: So this was just for spying. And for
KARL-HEINZ FROMMOLT: For fieldworkers.

– Yeah, for fieldwork.
– For fieldwork it's excellent.
– But mostly spies.

EMILY: Leeches, leeches, leeches.
ANNA PHILLIPS: Yes, you grab all the leeches.
– This is me at the club.
Boy, I like dabbing. Is that what people say?
In an unprecedented move, The Field Museum wants you to be a part of our history in a very real way.
EMILY: It all comes down to, like, my – I don't know.
My joy that The Field Museum feels so strongly about this
that we have research, staff, and scientists and artists
who are excited about it and that it was made possible
with the help from this strange little YouTube channel.
So make sure you like, subscribe, and hit that notification bell so you can update every time we post a new video.
Thanks. Bye.
[UPBEAT ELECTRONIC MUSIC]
EMILY: It still has brains on it.
